newsitem.title: USA: Novell Internet standard gets support.
newsitem.headline: Novell Internet standard gets support.

text.p: Novell Inc said on Monday that it is getting support from 12 print industry leaders for its drive to create a new technology standard to enable printing across the Internet.
If adopted, this proposed standard will simplify the ISO 10175 protocol used by major print vendors for ease of printing over the Internet and corporate intranets, a statement from Novell said.
The company said this will also present print vendors with the compatibility they need to support new and existing systems their customers use.

"There is a great need for creating a standard that will enable users to send and control print jobs to remote printers attached to the Internet," said Marc Epstein, vice president and general manager of Novell's Network Services Division.
